pullRequest.body: this is a theorem which is used in defining shifted Legendre Polynomial.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c859cc14e0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17853/commits/c859cc14e01ba43549ce9edb6614c4afcbae3acc)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ iterate_derivative_sum`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

> Looks like that this result only uses the linearity of `derivative^[k]`. Maybe if you write `(h m) • ((- 1) ^ m : R[X]) * X ^ (k + m)` as `C (h m * (-1) ^ m) * X ^ (k + m)` then it can be solve by the linearity of `derivative^[k]` (I'm not sure which theorem it is) and `Polynomial.iterate_derivative_C_mul`.
> 
> Maybe you can try `derivative ^ k` instead of `derivative^[k]`, the former is a linear map, but the latter is not; when apply to polynomials, these two are definitionally equal.

ok! thank you for your suggestion. But I see that `derivative^[k] `is used in the front of the document. I'm not sure if I want to change it to `derivative ^ k`?

I'm sorry, it's not `change` but you need to rw `LinearMap.pow_apply`. This code will work (note that I slightly changed your statement):
```lean
theorem iterate_derivative_finset_sum (k : ℕ) (h : ℕ → ℕ) :
    derivative^[k] (∑ m in Finset.range (k + 1), C (h m * (-1) ^ m : R) * X ^ (k + m)) =
    ∑ m in Finset.range (k + 1), C (h m * (-1) ^ m : R) * derivative^[k] (X ^ (k + m)) := by
  simp_rw [← LinearMap.pow_apply, map_sum, LinearMap.pow_apply, iterate_derivative_C_mul]
```
My suggestion is add a generic result (for example, `iterate_derivative_sum`, which is similar to `map_sum`, and you can put this result next to [Polynomial.derivative_sum](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/Derivative.html#Polynomial.derivative_sum)) to mathlib, and the result you want is easily proved by this result. Don't add results which has very few use cases.

Thanks for the PR! As people said above, this lemma is a pretty specific combination of existing ones. As a result, we won't add it to mathlib. We can however tell you how to replace it wherever you have used it in your project. Could you show us the project?

My recommendation is: instead, add the following result
```lean
theorem iterate_derivative_sum {s : Finset ι} {f : ι → R[X]} {k : ℕ} :
    derivative^[k] (∑ b ∈ s, f b) = ∑ b ∈ s, derivative^[k] (f b) := by
  simp_rw [← LinearMap.pow_apply, map_sum]
```
just after `derivative_sum` (at around L128), and this concludes your PR.

> Thanks for the PR! As people said above, this lemma is a pretty specific combination of existing ones. As a result, we won't add it to mathlib. We can however tell you how to replace it wherever you have used it in your project. Could you show us the project?

how can I show you the project? maybe I can add this lemma in the proof process?

> how can I show you the project? maybe I can add this lemma in the proof process?

The usual way to show reviewers where you are going is to have one huge PR containing all the final code and to split PRs off it

Thanks! 🚀

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors r+
:-1: Rejected by label
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11681739279/job/32527406423)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11681739279/job/32527406753)

Looks like that this result only uses the linearity of `derivative^[k]`. Maybe if you write `(h m) • ((- 1) ^ m : R[X]) * X ^ (k + m)` as `C (h m * (-1) ^ m) * X ^ (k + m)` then it can be solve by the linearity of `derivative^[k]` (I'm not sure which theorem it is) and `Polynomial.iterate_derivative_C_mul`.

Maybe you can try `derivative ^ k` instead of `derivative^[k]`, the former is a linear map, but the latter is not; when apply to polynomials, these two are definitionally equal.

Thanks!

maintainer merge

apart from that
This feels like a fairly odd statement. I'm wondering in particular what the `(-1 : R) ^ m` is for. Also there should be a space before `:=`
this is used to deal with the n-derivative of something like (a - x) ^ n.
So can you please add that result as a consequence?
sure! I add  this result at another pr which defined shiftedlegendre polynomial.
Ah, I meant adding it to this PR.

```suggestion
theorem iterate_derivative_sum (k : ℕ) (s : Finset ι) (f : ι → R[X]) :
    derivative^[k] (∑ b ∈ s, f b) = ∑ b ∈ s, derivative^[k] (f b) := by
```
because it's a rewriting lemma, and to match the order in which the variables appear
I think it's OK to make the parameters implicit? Just like what `derivative_sum` does.
I think it's not ok, no. This is a rewriting lemma. It should have its main arguments explicit. `derivative_sum` should be changed too, but that can be a separate PR

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: iterate derivative of finset sum
